posts.text:
Welcome to WordPress.com. After you read this, you should delete and write your own post, with a new title above. Or hit Add New on the left (of the admin dashboard) to start a fresh post.

Here are some suggestions for your first post.

  1. You can find new ideas for what to blog about by reading the Daily Post.
  2. Add PressThis to your browser. It creates a new blog post for you about any interesting  page you read on the web.
  3. Make some changes to this page, and then hit preview on the right. You can always preview any post or edit it before you share it to the world.

Cracked cooper pipes

Outwardly bleeding

The background noise

Pit Pit Pit

Whoosh

Heads bow, backs coil

Tentative blinking

A weary look

Smoke rises in the

Distance an inferno

Dissolves into the sky

Choking up the night

Sky with a smog of

Red and black

We struggle

Struggle

To return to our

Feet faces streaked

With tears and the

Wherring of vehicles

As they rush to the

Rescue, Clambering

Through the door the

Relentless Pit Pit Pit

Whoosh hits our ears

A hundred thousand

Screams deafens and

The Sound of

Pit Pit Pit whoosh

We are embraced by

An in inferno of heat

We crumple to the floor

Pit Pit Pit whoosh

We no longer hear

We no longer exists

We cease to be Human in a

World gone mad

Crashed out of time

Hands stood still

Quietness fell and

No more

Tic Toc

Split second

Moments

Hours

Never sure how

Much time passed

The hands of time

No longer

Tic Tocing

Not knowing when

To wake or sleep

The echoes of

Tic, tic, tic, toc

Lives in my head

If my lips were to touch you

With that tenderness i

Most feel you would be mine

In an instance. And you avoid

This touch a million times

Over. And tell me in whispers

How you will introduce me to

Your lover.

And if i cried for one moment

I know myself let down, instead

I lie and hide my passion, and

Conceal it in to mere words. And

Throw it to the sea.

My only hope the seas fathoms

Consume it whole  and let me fly

As free as you. And today, tomorrow

I can skip and rejoice in the fact

That i am indeed still me.

If you say the words often enough

You start to believe them, i do not

Without the last word it makes no

Sense but in my head it is because

I cannot or will not annunciate my

Wish.

And the words you will wish your

Life away tumble back into my minds

Eye and i have a feeling i already did

I thump my foot on the floor like a

Small child who is unable to force

Their own way

I look in your direction just turn

And run for the hills.

All such a cliché I know.

But wait a moment i have more.

Dashed puddles out of

Place with the magnitude of a

Jump. Mostly upwards.

Kicked pebbles at passing

Waves.

Chased clouds over hill tops

till i could no longer

Think.

Its like chasing rainbows over

Distant shores or following

Footprint in soft dry sand, stirred

Up by distant breezes. I wait for

That moment when you trace my

Lips. I wait for that moment when

We move together. And every now

And then we realize these feelings are

Merely the realm of dreams that no

Longer play a part. I reach for theA

Stem lift up the glass touch my

Lips to the cool glass and let the

Liquid run into my mouth. I swallow

Slowly and replace the glass running

My finger seductively over my lips

I kiss and let go. Your gaze drops

And i am lost again in a multitude of

Desires that are only prolonged by your

Gaze.

Kites flick flacked across the sky

Hooping in and out of clouds in

Angular motions

La, la, la they called in high pitch

Indignation before

Dancing off into the distance.

Quietness fell, the breeze lapped

At the seas edge catching

Small waves and licking them to the

Shoreline. The noise of dunes

Eloquently shoshing anyone 

Meandering through to the beach.

At least I’m doing something

Else, it’s like real work

 Without pay

 I work harder in the hope

Of being noticed and an

Introduction to the pay roll

Then my reality is not this

World but to sit at

Home thumping out words

On my laptop making up

Stories and poetry to tell

You at a later date.

I am a writer a story teller

my label, NOT lazy

When you ask me where my

Money comes from so I

Volunteer information

Which you infer that I’m

Some kind of scrounger

As my wallet or my bank

Account go unfilled you look

Down your nose in my direction

And see me as someone who

refuses to join the so

Called real world and smugley

Say all my friends are career

Girls not stay at home

And sneer at my passion so I

Go to work in hope of

Acceptance so I can say to you

At least I’m not simply

Sitting at home concentrating

On my writing. Or make believe

 It makes you feel slightly better

about my life

It makes me feel insignificant

And even a tiny bit invisible

October burst through and the

Crunch of leaves tantalises my

Senses, we climbed trees down

This path, i can still hear the

Excitement of babbling children

The tree lined path gave way to

Shades of gold and hues of

Brown.  Down the middle a

Stretch of white paint separates

The walker, from cyclist we

Scattered all over concealing

Ourselves behind skinny trees

Grown fat. I sit on the bench

And stare at the pond where once

We waded in for hours chasing

Insects like deranged cats. And

Now i simply sit and smile at

Memories long since gone and

Wish to reclaim the past.

Rain water pelted against the

Window pain, the moon bounced

Back a myriad of reflections as if

In an attempt to reflect each single

Ray of the sun reflected back.

And the moon beckoned ever more

As i lazily stared out of the window

Just waiting for something

Extraordinary to take place

One sigh followed another and I

Looked back over my shoulder to

You. Snoring loudly without a care

In the world and all the time I just

Wanted

 

Another sigh escaped and I returned

To myself made boredom and a cloud

Had blocked my view and the window

Payne fell dark without a single glint

I pressed my nail against my teeth and

Chewed a little harder till i cold take the

Boredom no more and left the room to

Make some tea and find my self some

Cake

 

I clattered around the kitchen in hope

Of making more noise than you, or even

To bring your attention rond to the fact I

Was no longer there, but to no avail and

All the time yo snored your self awake

Then back again and my existence was

Null and void or till you wished my

Presence at your side to ebb away your

Life’s boredom with me and sex

And I stared back at the moon wishing life

To hold more than this simply wish, and

The beams scattered over the rain soaked

Window and i pressed my head hard to

Feel the cold upon my skin wishing just

Whishing for something new.

Splintered into a thousand pieces

Piercing your skin a fluid line of

Red and we move apart slowly

Staring into each other’s eyes

I demand. You look back over

Your shoulder and shrug

All the time i am yours and you

Have no idea as you swear

Undyingly. You are your number

One and i am not even in second

Place. You take up the challenge

And brush up the splinters and

Decanter them you never

Hear the words or at least you

Do not acknowledge. Behind the

Door i feel the trickle the hot flood

From my eyes and you replace the

Lid and turn away, uttering the words

I don’t care.

 Copyright 2008
